gurmukhi: ieiq sRI bicqR nwtky mnu rwjw Avqwr solvwN ]16] squ suBm squ ]
transliteration: It(i) Sribachitra Naatake Manu Raajaa Avtaar Solvaan||16|| Sat(u) Soubham Sat(u)||
translation: For this work, the king Manu was MANU, the sixteenth incarnation in BACHITTAR BATAK.16.
Now begins the description of the incarnation named Dhanantar Vaid:
Let Sri Bhagauti Ji (The Primal Lord) be helpful.

gurmukhi: sB DnvMq Bey jg logw ] eyk n rhw iqno qn sogw ]
transliteration: Sabh Dhanvant Bhae Jag Logad|| Ek Na Rahaa Tino Tan Sogad||
translation: The people of all the world grew wealthy and there remained no anxiety on their body and mind.

gurmukhi: BwNq BwNq B`Cq pkvwnw ] aupjq rog doh iqn nwnw ]1]
transliteration: Bhaant Bhaant Bhachchhat Pakvaanaa|| Oupjat Rog Deh Tin Naanaa||1||
translation: They began to eat various kinds of foods and consequentsly they suffered form various kinds of ailments.1.

gurmukhi: rogwkul sB hI Bey logw ] aupjw AiDk pRjw ko sogw ]
transliteration: Rogadkul Sabh Hibhae Logad|| Oupjaa Adhik Prajaa Ko Sogad||
translation: All the people got worried about their ailments and the subjects became extremely distressed.

gurmukhi: prm purK kI krI bfweI ] kiRpw krI iqn pr hir rweI ]2]
transliteration: Param Purakh Kikaribadaaee|| Kridaa Karitin Par Har(i0 Raaee||2||
translation: All of them snag the praises of the Immanent Lord and He become Gracious towards all.2.

gurmukhi: ibsn cMd ko khw bulweI ] Dr Avqwr DnMqr jweI ]
transliteration: Bisan Channd Ko Kahaa Bulaaee|| Dhar Avtaar Dhanantar Jaaee||
translation: Vishnu was called by the Supreme Lord and ordered to manifest himself in the form of Dhanwantar.

gurmukhi: AwXurbyd ko kro pRkwsw ] rog pRjw ko kirXhu nwsw ]3]
transliteration: Aayurbed Ko Daro Prakaasaa|| Rog Prajaa Ko Kariyauh Naasaa||3||
translation: He also told him to spread Ayurveda and destroy the ailments of the subjects.3.

gurmukhi: qw qy dyv iekqR huAY mQXo smuMdiH jwie ]
transliteration: Ta Te Dev Ikatra Huai Mathyo Samounndrah(i) Jaae||
translation: Then all the gods gathered and churned the ocean,

gurmukhi: rog ibnwsn pRjw ihq kFXo DnMqr rwie ]4]
transliteration: Rog Binaasan Prajaa Hit Kadhyo Dhanantar Raae||4||
translation: And for the welfare of the subjects and destruction of their ailments, they acquired Dhanantar from the ocean.4.
